PROGRAMS - invoked from the command line (console)
    The pl program

PREFABS - produce graphs quickly from the command line without coding scripts
    Intro to prefabs
    Standard prefab parameters
    chron - display chronological data
    dist - frequency distribution histograms
    lines - line plots
    pie - pie graphs
    scat - scatterplots with correlations
    stack - stacked bar graphs
    vbars - bar graphs
    draw - interpret ploticus draw commands

SCRIPTS - for maximum flexibility and customization.
    Introduction to scripts
        Using procs and attributes; #proc, #procdef, #saveas, #clone
        Syntax and variables
        Flow of control directives such as #set and #if
        Using #shell and #sql
    Reserved variables
    Functions
    Script examples:   Index     PNG thumbnails     GIF thumbnails

    PLOTTING PROCS
    proc annotate - add annotation
    proc areadef - define a plotting area
        notes on automatic scaling
    proc axis (xaxis/yaxis) - render an axis
    proc bars - bar graphs, histograms, error bars
    proc curvefit - generate a curve from data points
    proc drawcommands - draw using command set
    proc getdata - get or specify plot data
    proc legend - render a legend
    proc line - draw arbitrary lines
    proc lineplot - produce a line plot
    proc page - set page-wide attributes/ break page
    proc pie - produce a pie graph
    proc rangebar - produce a rangebar / boxplot
    proc rangesweep - produce a range sweep
    proc rect - draw an arbitrary rectangle
    proc scatterplot - produce a scatterplot
    proc settings - overall settings for units, notations, etc

    UTILITY PROCS
    proc bevelrect - renamed proc rect
    proc breakaxis - break an axis for display of extreme values
    proc catslide - adjust placement of categories
    proc datesettings - renamed proc settings
    proc defineunits - explicitly define scaling units
    proc import - import an external PNG image file
    proc legendentry - define a legend entry explicitly
    proc originaldata - reference original data set
    proc print - show outliers, contents of variables, etc.
    proc processdata - process data set in various ways
    proc tabulate - perform tabulations & frequency distributions
    proc trailer - specify data at end of script
